tasks.task: Cutting and prepping bamboo for biochar production
subtasks: Using a battery-powered saber saw to cut bamboo
Felling bamboo and stacking it in the sun to dry
Trimming bamboo branches with a machete
Using a table saw to cut bamboo to size

tasks.task: Building and operating a biochar kiln
subtasks: Dug a pit for the kiln (1 meter deep, 2.5 meters across)
Starting the fire at the top of the pit using paper, kindling, and cardboard
Gradually adding bamboo as the fire progresses, maintaining a temperature between 450-550 degrees
Monitoring the kiln and preventing the bamboo from turning to ash
Using a hose to steam clean the biochar until the pit is full
Using an electric chipper/shredder to reduce biochar particles to earthworm digestible size
Mixing biochar with composted cow manure
Adding water to moisten the biochar
Introducing microbes to the biochar before application
Building a compost pile with biochar in the garden
Referencing the Kon-Tiki kiln design for scalable biochar production
Considering heat recovery for cooking or electricity generation
Promoting biochar as a scalable solution for carbon sequestration
